vulnerable_road_users.description: Ahead, on the right side of the road, a group of pedestrians can be seen, some of whom are close to the edge of the driving lane.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The behavior of pedestrians by the roadside is unpredictable; they may step into the driving lane, therefore it is necessary to stay alert and be ready to stop at any time.

other objects.description: The utility poles and wires on the side of the street are static objects, which have no direct impact on the driving behavior of this vehicle.
other objects.explanation: Caution: Pay attention to stationary objects; unless they are obstructing the road, there is no need to alter driving behavior.

general_perception.description and explanation: In the traffic image, there is a group of pedestrians ahead on the right side of the road, with some standing close to the edge of the driving lane. Since pedestrians can behave unpredictably and may step into the driving lane, it is crucial to stay alert and be prepared to stop at any time. Additionally, there are utility poles and wires on the side of the street, which are static objects and do not directly impact driving behavior. However, it is important to be cautious of stationary objects, ensuring they are not obstructing the road, which would necessitate altering driving behavior.

driving_suggestion: Drive cautiously at a slower speed, allowing for more reaction time. Be prepared to further slow down or stop if a motorcyclist or cyclist makes a sudden maneuver. Overtake only when it is safe and legal, giving vulnerable road users sufficient space. Additionally, maintain a low speed to have adequate reaction time should a pedestrian suddenly step onto the roadway. Pay close attention to parked tricycles for any signs of movement or doors opening, which may indicate the presence of pedestrians or vehicles entering the traffic flow.

1.description and explanation: This is a motorized tricycle with an enclosed cabin for the driver and space for cargo or passengers in the rear. As a vehicle in motion, it requires careful observation by the ego car driver to anticipate any potential changes in speed or direction that could affect traffic flow and safety.

2.description and explanation: A waste container, also known as a dustbin, placed adjacent to the roadway. While stationary and not an immediate threat to the ego vehicle, the presence of a dustbin suggests pedestrian activity and the potential for individuals to emerge onto the road, warranting caution and readiness to react.
